daoRules.daoRulesFlatDescription: No groups; all members have equal access.

daoRulesSections.daoRulesProposalsDescription: Who can submit proposals to your DAO? (submit is vote)

daoRulesSections.daoRulesStructureDescription: Select level of access to vote on proposals.

daoFlagForm.daoFlagCreateDescription: Both fields are optional. If you skip, default image will be used instead. An image and a logo together form a flag of your DAO!
daoFlagForm.daoFlagCoverUploadDescription: Cover will be used as a branded letterhead of your proposals, also small icon of your flag won’t include logo on it.
daoFlagForm.daoFlagLogoUploadDescription: Logo will be placed on top of your flag and will be visible on your full view DAO details.

daoPreviewForm.daoPreviewHeader: Preview of your custom DAO assets

daoPreviewFutureForm.daoMakeSureDescription: Make sure everything right and clear, this is how users will see your DAO on the platform!

daoAssets.createDaoAssetsDescription: Both fields are optional. If you skip, default image will be used instead. An image and a logo together form a flag of your DAO!

delegateVoting.policyDescription: A DAO member can only cast a vote if they hold an amount of tokens equal or greater to the minimum balance. When a vote is cast the total token weight in that direction compares against the threshold. If that token weight is greater than the threshold, the proposal finalizes with a pass or fail.

proposal.label: Proposal
proposal.description: for a general vote for a decision

proposalCard.proposalBountyUnclaimTime: Time to unclaim a bounty without penalty

proposalTypes.proposeDAOFlagAndLogo: Propose to Change DAO Flag and Logo
proposalTypes.proposeLegalStatusAndDoc: Propose to change DAO Legal Status and Doc
proposalTypes.proposeBondsAndDeadlines: Propose to Change Bonds and Deadlines
proposalTypes.proposeAddMember: Propose to Add Member to Group
proposalTypes.proposeRemoveMember: Propose to Remove Member from Group

upgradeContent.quorumDescr:
What is the quorum required
for the decision of this group

proposeGetUpgradeCode.description: Upgrading your DAO requires you to retrieve the new code you want your DAO to run. This proposal is to get a copy of the upgrade code. The code comes from the Sputnik DAO Factory, the same place your DAO came from when you created it.

proposeUpgradeSelf.description: Now that your DAO has a copy of the code it wants to run, it's time to propose that the DAO "Upgrades Itself." This proposal will switch the DAO from running its old code to the code you retrieved in step 1.

proposeRemoveUpgradeCode.description: Your DAO is now running the latest code! This proposal is to delete the upgrade code which you retrieved from the factory. Deleting that code saves NEAR for your DAO. It's safe to delete that code because smart contracts always store a copy of the code they're running.

proposeCreateDao.description: Because V2 DAOs can not be upgraded we will create a new DAO running the V3 smart contract. After this step we will transfer all assets to the V3 DAO.

proposeTransferFunds.description: To manage our assets with our new V3 DAO we will transfer them from our old V2 DAO. We're creating the proposals all at once but each proposal needs separate approval.

intro.description:
In this wizard we'll set up your DAO for token holder participation. If
        you haven't created your own NEP-141 fungible token then right now is a
        good time to hit up <0>tkn.farm</0>. Then you will deploy a staking contract,
        distribute tokens, and configure voting for holders.
intro.warningTitle: Setting up a governance token is a permanent change to your DAO.
intro.warningDetails: If you are unsure about taking this step it would be wise to research more and <0>experiment on testnet.</0>
intro.advOne: Creating your own governance token costs less than 3 NEAR at tkn.farm. Your NEP-141 fungible token isn't limited to governance. It's there for anything you and your community dream up.
intro.advTwo: Be mindful when distributing your tokens. By default, anyone who controls more than 50% of the token supply can attack your DAO.
intro.advThree: Owning your community token will be the smoothest route for people to vote in your DAO. Configure your groups and quorums so you never have to manually add or remove members in the future.
